1.text: He separating himself will seek according to desire; he will be irritated with every purpose.

2.text: The foolish one will not delight in understanding, but in, the disclosings of his heart.

3.text: In the coming of the unjust also came contempt, and with dishonor, reproach.

4.text: Deep waters are the words of man’s mouth, the fountain of wisdom a gushing stream.

5.text: To lift up the face of the unjust one is not good; to turn aside the just one in judgment.

6.text: The lips of the foolish one will come into contention, and his mouth will call for blows.

7.text: The mouth of the foolish is destruction to him, and his lips the snare of his soul.

8.text: The words of the tale-bearer as dainty morsels, and they will go down to the chambers of the belly.

9.text: Also he being slothful in his work, he the brother of the master of destruction.

10.text: The name of Jehovah a tower of strength: into it the just one shall run and be exalted.

11.text: The rich one’s wealth his strong city, and as a wall lifted up in his imagination.

12.text: Before a breaking a man’s heart will be lifted up, and before honor, humility.

13.text: He turning back the word before he shall hear it, is folly and shame to him.

14.text: The spirit of man will sustain his disease; and a dejected spirit who shall lift up?

15.text: The heart of him understanding will obtain knowledge and the ear of the wise will seek knowledge.

16.text: The gift of a man will enlarge to him, and shall conduct him before the great.

17.text: The first one just in his cause; his neighbor will come and search him.

18.text: The lot will cause contentions to cease, and will separate between the strong,

19.text: A brother falling away, above a city of strength; and strifes as the bars of a fortress.

20.text: From the fruit of a man’s mouth his belly shall be filled; and he shall be filled with the increase of his lips.

21.text: Death and life in the hand of the tongue: and they loving it shall eat its fruit.

22.text: He finding a wife found good, and shall obtain acceptance from Jehovah.

23.text: The poor one will speak supplications; and the rich one will answer with vehemence.

24.text: A man of friends for making friendship: and there is love attaching more than a brother.
